title: Employee Empowerment and Participatory Decision-Making Strategies for Organizational Learning Promotion

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of organizational management and leadership
context.additional_context: Targeting corporate managers/leaders in scientific fields, exploring strategies to establish an organizational learning culture and strengthen employee competencies

learning_goals: Learners can explain three core principles (e.g., psychological safety, trust-based collaboration, continuous feedback) for building environments that support organizational learning.
Learners can specify stages for applying participatory approaches when designing decision-making processes for employee empowerment.
Learners can apply practice-theory-based learning strategies (e.g., problem-solving workshops, action learning) tailored to the characteristics of science organizations to real-world cases.

resources: LMS Platform (Discussion Board, Video Conferencing Tool, Collaboration Tools)
Case Analysis Materials (Focused on Science Field Corporate Cases)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
